comment.author: 22919290@N08
comment._content: That's Church Road Jct in Dublin, down in the North Wall yards area. The view is looking west, with the bridge of the Dublin-Belfast line on the horizon. As the signal on one of the gantries is in the 'off' position, the loco is coming towards O'Dea presumebly to shunt or take out of a goods train. The Brennan's shop is now an ordinary residence.

comment.author: 13713567@N06
comment._content: Many time I worked in and out of all 3 North Wall yards with freight.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/13713567@N06] Hello Tom. If you get a chance, you should go to the new cinema beside the Gibson Hotel behind the Point Depot/O2. There are floor to ceiling windows really high up with a fantastic view over the North Wall Freight Depot. And while you're here, have you had a look at our O'Dea railway photos?
